_label: Standing Officer Holding a Boar's Spear

identified_by.content: Standing Officer Holding a Boar's Spear

referred_to_by.content: G. Braamkamp, Amsterdam; (?-1768); his sale, P. Yver, Amsterdam, 29 February 1768, no. 265. (1768); Van Der Hoog, Amsterdam. (ca. 1768-ca. 1780); his sale, Amsterdam,10 April 1780, no. 128 (1780); Sold, P. Yver, Amsterdam, 30 October 1780, no. 3. (1780); Juda van Benjamin Senior, Amsterdam (?-1782); his sale, Jan Willem Smit, Amsterdam, 4 November 1782, no. 27 (1782); John 2nd Lord Northwick (1770-1859), London (?-1859); his sale, "remaining portion of" his collection, Sotheby, Wilkinson & Hodge, London, 5 July 1921, no. 79 (1921); Sir Robert Witt (1872-1952), London (Lugt 2228b) (ca. 1920s-ca. 1952); Dr. and Mrs. Frances Springell (1898-1974), Portinscale, Cumberland (Lugt 1049a) (by 1959-1974); sold Sotheby Mak van Waay B.V., Amsterdam, 3 May 1976, lot 93 (1976); with Hazlitt, Gooden & Fox Ltd., London (1994); The Cleveland Museum of Art, Cleveland, OH (1994)
